intro: Ouratea valerii, commonly known as the silver leaf tree or white hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with a distinctive silvery underside. The plant produces small, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the summer months. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance. The tree can grow up to 10 meters tall and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
